turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey! I need some fashion advice. I'm trying to revamp my wardrobe, but I'm on a pretty tight budget. Like, under $200 total for several outfits. Is that even possible?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hi there! Definitely possible. Let's start with some basics. To give you the best recommendations, what kind of style are you going for? Casual, professional, something in between? Also, what climate do you live in? This will affect the fabrics and types of clothing I suggest.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, good to hear it's *possible*. I'm aiming for a smart casual look, something I can wear to a relaxed office or out for coffee. And I live in a place with mild winters, so layering is key, I guess? I'm so overwhelmed; where do I even start?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, smart casual with layering in mind. Consider starting with versatile basics from stores like H&M, Uniqlo, or Target. A good foundation would be: a neutral-colored blazer ($30-40), a couple of basic tees ($10 each), a button-down shirt ($20-30), dark wash jeans ($30), and a pair of versatile chinos ($25). These items can be mixed and matched. For layering, think about a cardigan or light jacket ($30-40). Does that give you a better starting point?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's actually pretty helpful! But what about shoes? I need something that works with all of those outfits, and shoes are usually so expensive! And what if I want to add, like, one statement piece to make it a little less... basic? I'm feeling a little more optimistic now though, thanks!
